lexUnit.name: smirk.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a smug or silly smile.

sentence.text: Not bothering to conceal a smirk of satisfaction , he announced , ` We 're going to have to let the bugger go . "
I thought I detected a smirk on the face of Mills Roberts .
Gloomily , she remembered the smirk on Gould 's face , the surprise and disappointment on Annie 's .
He saw the smirk on Donald 's glassy face .
` Look at the self-satisfied smirk on the man 's face .
I finished my drink , quickly said goodbye to the other actors and got out as fast as I could , not wanting to register their smirks and curiosity .
Mr Falt could be forgiven his smirk when , on election day , he was able to report not a body count but a remarkable turnout of voters .
Desperately he tried to force his mind away , but the mud and the caravan , and the smell of , cats and drink and flesh , and Holly 's smirk flooded back , nauseating him .
Athelstan , however , informed them his companion was no less a personage than Sir John Cranston , who was now ill , so they stepped aside , doing their best to hide their smirks .
The reaction of the locals varied from an ill-concealed smirk to a barely suppressed guffaw .
The girls , elbows propping up against the wall behind , hips thrust forward , blew them two almost toothless smirks as the windscreen wipers cut a valiant swathe through the dried spittle .
I know what profession she 's in , and no wonder that taxi driver was giving me the big smirk .
She gave an unpleasant smirk .
He gave Lambert a grubby smirk .
If you can manage that , and , come out with the right answer , then there 's a pretty good chance you 'll have a smirk on your face the next time the heavens open .

Albert , she had remarked -- Rose had n't known Twitch even had a Christian name -- is like pummy stone , whereas Naseby ( who had had a definite smirk on his face when he saw her new hat ) is like Irritating Plaster , he causes irruptions .
But all I got in reply was a squinty smirk and the hiss of piss .
I shrugged and Gloria pursed her mouth in a self-satisfied smirk .

She wanted to take that thick neck of his and press her fingernails , long and freshly varnished for Urquhart 's benefit , deep into the flesh until the cocky smirk on his face was replaced by a grimace of pain .
Corbett thought of de Craon 's evil smirk and then Bruce with his cruel mouth and perfect knowledge of French .
So instead of being outraged , one is left with a resigned smirk .
` She says she can feel keys , " said Holly with a smirk .
` So I do n't think he found me quite so ridiculous as you make out , " concluded Viola , with an angry smirk of triumph .
If he had n't known that fact himself , Devlin Parnham had pointed it out to him repeatedly with a self-satisfied little smirk .
